page.title: 11CATHERINE COOKSON TRAIL
page.content: In June 1985{South Tyneside Council} launched a Â£70,000 campaign aimed at boosting tourism in the area.The theme being{'Catherine Cookson Country'}This highlights the life and work of the world famous writer and advertises the historic and scenic delights of the area. {Catherine Cookson}loves the area having been born and bred here and South Shields and East Jarrow were the inspiratin for her early works.She has written more than 65 books and her autobiography{"Our Kate"}and the { "Mary Ann"}books are probably best known. There is a 'Catherine Cookson Trail'designed to indicate her early life in the area and to show the local setting for some of her books. In addition the other main tourist locations are given prominence.
